full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 311-1 Filed 07/02/21 Page 20 of 23

x j3q1gra

SEALED

1 in order to give whatever in discovery they gave, whether it
2 was deposition testimony they gave or -- then again, I can't
3 fathom why anybody who has any criminal exposure would not have
4 taken the Fifth Amendment in response to questions in a civil
5 deposition, but I don't know.

MR. ROSSMILLER: So just taking that very briefly in
6 order, your Honor, I do not know, but I think it is entirely
7 possible that what we are seeking is page after page of people
8 taking the Fifth. That is entirely possible. But to the
9 extent that it is not or there are other materials -- and this
10 may be bad for our argument, but in all transparency and
11 candor, I think there may be other individuals who also relied
12 on the protective order. In other words, anyone other than the
13 parties who were deposed may have, in theory, and perhaps
14 unreasonably, relied on it.

THE COURT: For example, the target of your
15 investigation.

MR. ROSSMILLER: For example, the target of our
16 investigation. But I don't think that the parties would be
17 differently situated in terms of their rights, and there are
18 certainly many cases that talk about how the government has the
19 ability to grant immunity in a criminal investigation, but not,
20 of course, through restricting materials --

THE COURT: But that's the whole point of the
21 government needing to follow the procedure, the proper
22
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300 SDNY_GM_00000871
DOJ-OGR-00004913
